caption.paragraph:
Figs. 53-65.
Euricania ocellus (Walker)
: 53, vertex, pronotum and mesonotum, dorsal view; 54, frons and clypeus; 55, tegmina; 56, wing; 57, male genitalia, left side; 58, male anal segment, dorsal view; 59, aedeagus, dorsal view; 60, aedeagus, ventral view; 61, aedeagus, left side; 62, female genitalia, left side; 63, female anal segment, dorsal view; 64, gonophysis VIII, right side; 65, pregenital sternite. Scale bars: Figs. 53, 54, 62 = 1.25mm; Figs. 55, 56 = 3.2mm; Fig. 57 = 0.635mm; Figs. 58, 59-61, 63 = 0.4mm; Figs. 64, 65 = 0.5mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Length (incl. teg.). â€“ Male 10.5-11.0 mm, female 11.0-12.0 mm.
Legs yellow; fore femora with 2-3 lateral spines; middle femora with 4-5 lateral spines. Abdomen brown or dark brown. Tegula brown or dark brown. Eyes piceous, ocelli rufous.
Distribution. â€“ China ( Guangxi , Hainan , Hunan , Guizhou , Taiwan) ; Bengal, Sikkim, India , Japan , Vietnam .

Remarks. â€“ This species is similar to
E. brevicula
, but can be separated from the latter by its shorter sublateral carinae of frons ( Fig. 54 ) and very long dorsal spinose process of the male phallobase ( Fig. 59 ).
Host plants. â€“ Silver chain, orange, tea plant, tung, and castoroil plant.
